answers.answer: tell your doctor about those signs...it could be preeclampsia symptoms.So just be safe
Oh wow I didn't even realize that. I'll definitely bring it up at my next appointment
It could also be due to anemia, I've always been anemic and pregnancy has made it even worse, headaches and dizziness is common because of the low blood count
Hmm that could be it I had anemia with my first child. Thank you (: I'm gonna get it checked out just in case. In only 12 weeks so I know I'm still going through all the first trimester changes
My friend had them signs in the end she did have preeclampsia so I would get it checked asap

Like you said, get checked out either way. Even if it's just anemia, the reason I have anemia is due to a blood disorder called beta thalassemia, it doesn't let the body absorb iron to create more blood cells, now I have an appointment with an OB on the 1st to decide on what to do since my blood count keeps dropping lower, iron tablets aren't really working either.... Baby is fine though :)
You should call your doctor they will ask you to go in soon dont wait till your nxt appointment i had a very bad headache & then i got numb so they tild me to go in ASAP b/c it could me preeclampsia
I have my next appointment on Thursday so it's coming up soon I'll make sure to ask (:
Today I had a check n bp was high she was asking me if I have headache or dizziness she was ruling out preeclamsia!

question: Does anyone else get dizzy & super bad headaches? How do you make it go away? I get like this even when I eat & drink bottle after bottle of water.
title: Dizziness
